channel.title: Announcement on Sujith Quintelier
channel.description: Recent content in Announcement on Sujith Quintelier

item.title: github: 1 vCPU Linux runner now generally available in GitHub Actions
item.description:
GitHub Actions now offers 1 vCPU Linux runners as generally available (GA). These lower-cost runners are optimized for automation tasks and issue operations and are available to all customers.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: GitHub Copilot now supports OpenCode
item.description:
GitHub announced a formal partnership with OpenCode that enables authentication of GitHub Copilot subscriptions (Pro, Pro+, Business, Enterprise) on the OpenCode platform, allowing subscribers to use Copilot with OpenCode.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: Copilot SDK in technical preview
item.description:
GitHub released the Copilot SDK in technical preview, offering language-specific SDKs that let developers programmatically access the GitHub Copilot CLI.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: Reduced pricing for GitHub-hosted runners usage
item.description:
GitHub has reduced pricing for GitHub-hosted runners — price cuts of up to 39% are now in effect; the change was announced on December 16, 2025.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: Copilot Memory early access for Pro and Pro+
item.description:
GitHub announced that Copilot Memory is now available in early access for Copilot Pro and Pro+ users. The feature is supported in the Copilot Coding Agent and Copilot Code Review. The provided article text is truncated; full details are on the GitHub Blog.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: Coming soon: Simpler pricing and a better experience for GitHub Actions
item.description:
Starting January 1, 2026, GitHub will lower prices for GitHub-hosted runners by up to 39% (varying by machine type) to deliver simpler pricing and a better GitHub Actions experience; free usage minute quotas will remain unchanged.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: GitHub Spark: Improvements, DPA coverage, & dedicated SKU
item.description:
GitHub announced a set of improvements for Spark, introduced a dedicated Spark SKU, and confirmed that Spark is covered by the GitHub Data Processing Agreement (DPA).

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: vscode: Introducing the VS Code Insiders Podcast
item.description:
Announcement of the VS Code Insiders Podcast — a new series serving as an insider’s guide to the features, decisions, and people shaping the future of Visual Studio Code.

  • Source: Visual Studio Code

item.title: github: Plan mode in GitHub Copilot now in public preview in JetBrains, Eclipse, and Xcode
item.description:
GitHub Copilot’s Plan mode is now available in public preview for JetBrains IDEs, Eclipse, and Xcode, announced on the GitHub Blog.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: azure: [Launched] Generally Available: Microsoft Python driver for SQL Server
item.description:
Microsoft announced that the mssql-python driver for SQL Server is now generally available (GA). The release delivers a modern, high-performance, and developer-friendly experience for Python developers working with SQL Server and Azure SQL Database.

  • Source: Azure Updates

item.title: dotnet: Introducing C# 14
item.description:
Announcement post introducing C# 14 and its features; C# 14 ships as part of .NET 10 and the full post is on the .NET Blog.

  • Source: .NET

item.title: github: Actions pull_request_target and environment branch protections changes
item.description:
GitHub will change how Actions’ pull_request_target and environment branch protection rules are evaluated for pull-request-related events, effective 2025-12-08, to reduce security-critical exposures.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: dotnet: Get Ready for .NET Conf 2025!
item.description:
Announcement: .NET Conf 2025 is scheduled for November 11–13, featuring .NET 10 and Visual Studio 2026, with a Student Zone on November 14.

  • Source: .NET

item.title: azure: Retirement: Azure Computer Vision – Image Analysis will be retired on September 25, 2028
item.description:
Microsoft announced the planned retirement of the Azure Computer Vision – Image Analysis service, with full support provided through September 25, 2028.

  • Source: Azure Updates

item.title: azure: Retirement: Spark Native Connector for Semantic Link
item.description:
Microsoft announces the retirement of the Spark native connector effective October 1, 2025, citing low usage, high maintenance costs, and potential security vulnerabilities; source text is truncated before completing the stated goal.

  • Source: Azure Updates

item.title: github: New date for enforcement of cache eviction policy
item.description:
GitHub is delaying enforcement of a new cache eviction policy for GitHub Actions from mid-October to November. The current per-repository cache limit remains 10 GB while the enforcement date is postponed.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: Upcoming deprecation of gh-copilot CLI extension
item.description:
GitHub announced the scheduled deprecation of the GitHub Copilot CLI extension (gh-copilot) for the GitHub CLI; the extension will stop working on October 25, 2025.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: GitHub MCP Registry: The fastest way To discover AI tools
item.description:
GitHub announced the MCP Registry, a centralized place to discover MCP servers and AI tools so developers can more quickly find and connect AI agents to their development workflows. The registry aims to replace hunting through multiple registries, repositories, and community threads with a single searchable catalog.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: azure: Retirement: Microsoft Playwright Testing (Preview) will be retired on March 8, 2026
item.description:
Microsoft Playwright Testing (Preview) will be retired on March 8, 2026. Azure App Testing — introduced last August to unify Azure Load Testing and Microsoft Playwright Testing — is the consolidated testing service for running large-scale functional and performance tests.

  • Source: Azure Updates
